translated: Therefore, the yogi/nÄ« of the indivisibility of the three vajras, always, i.e., uninterruptedly, obtains just that, the state of the nature of body, speech, and mind. This is the conduct of the yogi/nÄ« of reality.

analyzed: khro ba ni mi bskyod pa'o //

original: ngo tsha ba ni don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba ni don yod grub pa ste /

analyzed: 'di dag gi rang bzhin nyid kyis yongs su bcad pa ni bya ba'o //

original: de'i phyir spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir spang bar bya ste /

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: gnyid dang bdag nyid rab spangs nas //
analyzed: gnyid dang bdag nyid rab spangs nas //
translated: having abandoned sleep and pride,

original: the tshom med par spyod par bya //
analyzed: the tshom med par spyod par bya //
translated: one should practice without hesitation.

original: gnyid ces pa dbang po dang yul la 'dod pa'i bya ba sdud pa nyid kyis gnyid ni bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: gnyid ces pa dbang po dang yul la 'dod pa'i bya ba sdud pa nyid kyis gnyid ni bdag med ma ste /

analyzed: de rnam par dag pas de yongs su spong ba'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pas rtogs pa'o ;

original: / de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid rab du spangs te /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid rab du spangs te /

original: bdag tu lta ba bcad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba bcad pa'i phyir //

analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon du byas nas spros pa med pa'i spyod pa bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //

original: lus kyi sbyin pa byin nas ni //
analyzed: lus kyi sbyin pa byin nas ni //

original: phyi nas spyod pa yang dag brtsam //
analyzed: phyi nas spyod pa yang dag brtsam //

original: zhes pa dang por bdag spangs pa las //
analyzed: zhes pa dang por bdag spangs pa las //

analyzed: de'i rjes la lus chos thams cad do //

analyzed: spyod pa gang yin pa de yang dag par bstan pa 'di nyid brtsam par bya'o //

analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sbyin pa byin mi bya //

analyzed: the tshom med par spyod pa bya //

analyzed: phyi nas spyod pa yang dag brtsam //

translated: The â€œpractice of shameâ€ is shame and practice. Abandoning those is the â€œabandoning the practice of shame,â€ which means â€œbeing outside of the analysis of the practice of shame.â€

original: rgyu gang gi phyir dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par dpyad cing rnam par gnas par bya ste //
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par dpyad cing rnam par gnas par bya ste //

original: de'i phyir yo g'i'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yo g'i'o //

original: gal te kun du rtog pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir bslab pa la sogs pa yang spangs pa yin na 'di ni de mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa yang byed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te kun du rtog pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'i phyir bslab pa la sogs pa yang spangs pa yin na 'di ni de mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa yang byed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la gsungs pa /
translated: If, because of completely abandoning all conceptual thoughts, one also abandons the trainings, etc., then would one not also perform the ten non-virtues, etc.?ğŸ”½[The BhagavÄn] says,

original: snying rje che zhes pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje che zhes pa ste /
translated: â€œgreat compassion.â€

original: gang gis brtse ba chen por gyur pa de ni snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: gang gis brtse ba chen por gyur pa de ni snying rje chen po ste /

original: 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa rnams pa de'i blo rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don gyi bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa rnams pa de'i blo rnam pa thams cad du mi 'jug pa kho na'o //

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi 'dzin pa nye bar zhi bar byed do zhes pa'o //

original: yang na / bslab pa zhes pa rig pa ste bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: yang na / bslab pa zhes pa rig pa ste bdag med ma'o //

original: de nyid sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can ni bya ba'o //

original: gang gis de dag las rnam par grol ba de ni bslab dang bya las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis de dag las rnam par grol ba de ni bslab dang bya las rnam par grol ba ste /

original: bdag med ma nyams su myong ba'i kun du rtog pa yang de la yod pa ma yin zhing rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phong la gnas pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med ma nyams su myong ba'i kun du rtog pa yang de la yod pa ma yin zhing rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phong la gnas pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: The imagination of the experience of NairÄtmya does not exist for him, and he abides in the state of Vajradhara.

original: ngo tsha'i 'bras bu rnam par spangs //
analyzed: ngo tsha'i 'bras bu rnam par spangs //

original: zhes pa ngo tsha ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ngo tsha ni mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag med ma'o //

original: bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang ste /

original: de khyad par ci zhe na /
analyzed: de khyad par ci zhe na /

analyzed: spros pa'i ngo bos snying rje che //

original: yang na / sbyin sreg mchod sbyin dka' thub 'das //

analyzed: aom mgrin par ro //

original: a'a: snying gar ro //
analyzed: a'a: snying gar ro //

original: de khyad par ci zhe na /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir / ngas par sngon du lha min gang // brgya byin lta bu yin na yang //

original: don go sla ba nyid do //

analyzed: yang na / brgya byin gyi sgras dbang po ste /

original: de nyid nges par phung po ma lus par gyur pa'o ;

translated: Just as a lion moves about without fear, so also one should move about everywhere without fear in the form of a lion, and one should pervade everywhere.ğŸ”½One should move about everywhere without fear.

original: thams cad du dogs pa med pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa yongs su spang pa yongs su spang ba'i kun du rtog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad du dogs pa med pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa yongs su spang pa yongs su spang ba'i kun du rtog par 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: rtag tu snying rjes btung bar bya //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //

analyzed: de rnams thams cad dang sems can yang yin pa'i phyir sems can thams cad de /

original: gang zhig ming med ston pa na //ğŸ”½de la mgrin pa rab tu bstan //
analyzed: gang zhig ming med ston pa na // de la mgrin pa rab tu bstan //

analyzed: zhes pa sngar / gang zhig ming med ston pa na //

original: zhes pa rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgyag bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgyag bshad pa'o //

original: da ni / gang zhig ming med ston pa na //
analyzed: da ni / gang zhig ming med ston pa na //

original: de yi mgrin pa rab tu bstan //
analyzed: de yi mgrin pa rab tu bstan //

analyzed: zhes pa gal te rnal 'byor ma ming med ston pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa mgrin pa bstan par bya'o zhes pa ste /

original: 'dis sngar brjod ba'i brda rnams la rnal 'byor ma'i brda lag pa g-yon pa dang rnal 'byor pa'i brda yang lag pa g-yas pa zhes pa'o //

original: yang na / ming med ces pa 'od dpag med byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: yang na / ming med ces pa 'od dpag med byang chub kyi sems te /

original: de ston pa ni snang ba rnam par dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa ni snang ba rnam par dag par byed pa'o //

original: mgrin pa zhes pa mgrin pa 'dab ma bcu drug nyid kyis stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mgrin pa zhes pa mgrin pa 'dab ma bcu drug nyid kyis stong pa nyid bcu drug gi rang bzhin no //

analyzed: snang ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid kyi snying rje'i rang bzhin te /

analyzed: yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin yang cha dang bral ba nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //

original: de nyid kyi phyir ni'i sgra ni khyad par gyi don te /

translated: Therefore, the word â€œindeedâ€ has the meaning of distinction.

analyzed: de ltar khyad par du 'phags pa nyid las byang chub kyi sems stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i phyir y'a /

analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i rab tu bstan zhes pa byang chub kyi sems de'i rab tu bstan pa phul du byung ba'i ye shes te /

analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis ka dbyer med pa yang dag pa'i ye shes rab tu mthong zhes pa'o //

original: gang zhig gos ni ston pa na //
analyzed: gang zhig gos ni ston pa na //

analyzed: de yi rtse gsum rab tu bstan //

analyzed: yang na gos zhes pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //

analyzed: de yi mtshams ni rab tu bstan //

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dang gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis tshad med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu 'gyed pa nyid nye bar bzung nas 'od byed pa zhes brjod do //

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos ston pa'i dbang gis /
translated: The tenth stage is called the stage of the Cloud of Dharma, because it is the basis for the teaching of the Dharma in all its aspects.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros yangs pa brnyes pa nye bar bzung nas legs pa'i blo gros zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros yangs pa brnyes pa nye bar bzung nas legs pa'i blo gros zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the stage of Good Intellect, because it is the basis for the attainment of the vast, irreproachable intellect.

original: chos kyi mdzod sprin chen po lta bus khams gsum pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'i sems can gyi khams rnams chos kyi char gyis tshim par byed pa nyid lta bur bzung nas chos kyi sprin zhes brjod do //ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa'i sgrog pa shin tu phra mo rab tu /
analyzed: chos kyi mdzod sprin chen po lta bus khams gsum pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i nam mkha' lta bu'i sems can gyi khams rnams chos kyi char gyis tshim par byed pa nyid lta bur bzung nas chos kyi sprin zhes brjod do // nyon mongs pa'i sgrog pa shin tu phra mo rab tu /
translated: It is called the stage of the Cloud of Dharma, because it is the basis for the satisfaction of the realm of living beings, which is like the sky in the three worlds, with the rain of Dharma, which is like a great cloud of the treasure of the Dharma.

original: spangs pa las chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya yang dag par rtogs pa nyid nye bar bzung nas bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis zhes brjod do //
analyzed: spangs pa las chags pa med cing thogs pa med par shes bya yang dag par rtogs pa nyid nye bar bzung nas bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis zhes brjod do //
translated: The eleventh stage is called the stage of the Perfect Intellect, because it is the basis for the perfect realization of the knowable, without attachment and without obstruction, through the abandonment of even the most subtle fetters of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags lhag ma med par rab tu spangs pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par @134b byang chub pa nye bar bzung nas bcu gnyis pa rdo rje 'chang gis zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags lhag ma med par rab tu spangs pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par @134b byang chub pa nye bar bzung nas bcu gnyis pa rdo rje 'chang gis zhes brjod do //
translated: Having taken up the complete and perfect enlightenment of the knowledge of all aspects from the complete abandonment of the remaining predispositions of the afflictions, it is called the twelfth stage of Vajradhara.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bcu rnams te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bcu rnams te /
translated: The ten stages of the Joyful and so forth areğŸ”½the stage of devoted engagement.

original: mos pa spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyi /
translated: Since the cause, which is the nature of the stage of devoted engagement,ğŸ”½is also the result, the stage of buddhahood, they are not different.

original: rgyur gyur pa mos pa spyod pa yang 'bras bur gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir tha dad med pas 'bras bur gyur pa sangs rgyas kyis dang 'bras bur gyur pa rdo rje 'chang gi sa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis dbye ba med
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa mos pa spyod pa yang 'bras bur gyur pa sangs rgyas kyi sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i phyir tha dad med pas 'bras bur gyur pa sangs rgyas kyis dang 'bras bur gyur pa rdo rje 'chang gi sa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis dbye ba med
translated: Therefore, since the stage of devoted engagement is the cause of the stage of buddhahood and the stage of Vajradhara, which is the result, they are not differentiated.

original: pa'i phyir mos pa spyod pa'i sa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang rdo rje 'chang gis yang ste /
analyzed: pa'i phyir mos pa spyod pa'i sa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang rdo rje 'chang gis yang ste /
translated: Therefore, the stage of devoted engagement is the stage of buddhahood and the stage of Vajradhara.

original: sa bcu dbye ba med pa nyid do zhes pa sa bcu rnams so //
analyzed: sa bcu dbye ba med pa nyid do zhes pa sa bcu rnams so //
translated: Since the ten stages are not differentiated, they are the ten stages.

original: dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dbyer med pa'i gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu rnams dang rim pa ji lta bar sbyar bar bya'o zhes pas bcu'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas dang mgon po rdo rje 'chang
analyzed: dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dbyer med pa'i gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa rnams rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu rnams dang rim pa ji lta bar sbyar bar bya'o zhes pas bcu'i dbang phyug sangs rgyas dang mgon po rdo rje 'chang
translated: Thus, the Lord of the ten stages is the Buddha and the Lord Vajradhara.

original: gnyis so zhes brjod bya gzhan gyis min /

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa sa bcu rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po dang yul rnam par dag bar blta bar bya'o //

translated: The ten stages, such as the places and the neighboring places, are to be seen as the pure faculties and objects of the bodhisattvas.

original: dur khrod ni sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par shes par dag par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: bya ba yod na bya ba ma yin pa'ang yod par 'gyur gyi /

original: bya ba med pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin pa yang med de /
analyzed: bya ba med pa'i phyir bya ba ma yin pa yang med de /
translated: But because there is no action, there is also no non-action,

original: rdo rje 'chang ni kun du rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang ni kun du rtog pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because Vajradhara is beyond all conceptual thought.

original: yang na / 'di ni 'dus pa der //
analyzed: yang na / 'di ni 'dus pa der //
translated: Moreover,

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams gang dang gang //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams gang dang gang //
translated: whatever the yoginis sayğŸ”½in that assembly,

original: smra ba de dag thams cad bya //
analyzed: smra ba de dag thams cad bya //
translated: all that should be done.

original: zhes gang mdor bstan pa de //ğŸ”½mi bya cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: zhes gang mdor bstan pa de // mi bya cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: This is the brief teaching.

original: zhes pa 'di rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation:ğŸ”½There is nothing at all that should not be done.

original: de nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Therefore,

original: de la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa 'gal ba dang 'gal ba med pa nyid med par shes par bya ste /ğŸ”½de rnams @139a * //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa 'gal ba dang 'gal ba med pa nyid med par shes par bya ste / de rnams @139a * //

original: kyi yid dbang du gyur pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi yid dbang du gyur pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have attained mastery over their minds.

original: rtag tu mi bza' yod ma yin //
analyzed: rtag tu mi bza' yod ma yin //

original: zhes pa 'dus pa der bza' ba ma yin pa yang bza' bar bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dus pa der bza' ba ma yin pa yang bza' bar bya ba nyid de /
translated: In that assembly, even what should not be eaten should be eaten,

original: sems can lan bdun pa yang bza' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can lan bdun pa yang bza' ba'i phyir ro //

original: lan bdun pa yang bza' bar bya //
analyzed: lan bdun pa yang bza' bar bya //

original: yang yid las sems can gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang yid las sems can gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: One should also eat other sentient beings, who are mental.

original: gang smras de dag thams cad bza' //
analyzed: gang smras de dag thams cad bza' //
translated: One should eat all of them, as they are said to be.

original: sku ni snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis sku rdo rje bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: sku ni snang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis sku rdo rje bza' bar bya'o //

original: de ni gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir bza' bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i phyir bza' bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be eaten, because it is originally unborn.

original: sku'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-conceptuality of the body.

original: kun du rtog pa de med pa'i phyir yang mi bza' ba med ces pa ma ning du bstan to //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa de med pa'i phyir yang mi bza' ba med ces pa ma ning du bstan to //

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtag tu zhes pa yod par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtag tu zhes pa yod par gyur pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is always existent.

original: aa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma bdag med ma 'di rang bzhin sku'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: aa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma bdag med ma 'di rang bzhin sku'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //

original: 'di la mi bsam yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di la mi bsam yod ma yin //
translated: There is no existence of this thought.

original: gang smra ba de thams cad bya ste /
analyzed: gang smra ba de thams cad bya ste /

original: de'i phyir 'dir bsam par bya ba ni bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bsam par bya ba ni bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'o //

original: yang na bsam par bya ba ma yin pa bsam par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bsam par bya ba ma yin pa bsam par bya ba ste /
translated: Or, the inconceivable is the object of thought.

original: bsam par bya ba ni sems kyi yul yin la sems kyi yul nyid sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bsam par bya ba ni sems kyi yul yin la sems kyi yul nyid sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: de'i yul yang med do zhes pa bsam par bya ba med pa'o //

original: de med pa'i phyir bsam par bya ba ma yin pa yang med de /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir bsam par bya ba ma yin pa yang med de /

analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa las rig pa ye shes kyis rnam par gnas par bya'o //

original: ci ltar gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar gang gi phyir /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di la kye yi rdo rje 'dir //
analyzed: 'di la kye yi rdo rje 'dir //
translated: Here, in this Hevajra,

original: bzang ngan mi smra gang yang med //
analyzed: bzang ngan mi smra gang yang med //

original: smra ba ni smra bar bya ba dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: smra ba ni smra bar bya ba dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa ste /

original: de yang sems kyi yul nyid kyi phyir dang / sems de yang sems med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / smra bar bya ba nyid de de med pa yin pa'i phyir /

original: smra bar bya ba ma yin pa yang med do //
analyzed: smra bar bya ba ma yin pa yang med do //

original: de'i phyir smra bar bya ba dang smra bar bya ba ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir bzang ba dang ngan pa mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa'i kun du rtog pa yang med pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smra bar bya ba dang smra bar bya ba ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir bzang ba dang ngan pa mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa'i kun du rtog pa yang med pa nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because there is no conception of what is to be spoken and what is not to be spoken, there is no conception of good and bad, of sign and signless.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And so:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i kun rtog las // dge ba'am gal te mi dge ba //
translated: From the conception of the BodhisattvağŸ”½all is good, or if not good,

translated: He is beyond the conceptualization of mind because he transcends the conceptualization of what is to be thought and what is not to be thought. He is beyond the conceptualization of speech because he has abandoned the conceptualization of what is to be spoken and what is not to be spoken.

analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / bdag la ji ltar sems can la //

translated: The mandala of Vajradhara and Nairatmya is the three vajras of their body, speech, and mind, which are the nature of the five pristine awarenesses.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i kye'i rdo rje der /

analyzed: de yang le'u ni de rnams sbas pa len pa dang 'dzin pa'i phyir le'u'o //

analyzed: de yang bdun pa ni de kho na'i le'u'i mthar thug pa lnga rnams kyi lnga dang / spyod pa dang bya ba bdag gis gnyis te /

original: spyod pa dang bya ba'i bdag nyid kho na ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin drug pa rdo rje 'chang dang de las 'das pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin bdun pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //

original: a'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gang yin pa de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba ste /
analyzed: a'a li n'a da'i phreng ba gang yin pa de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba ste /

analyzed: de ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad /

original: snang ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: snang ba'i mtshan nyid /

original: sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku'o //

original: bdun gyi bdun pa mnyam nyid ldan //

analyzed: mnyam nyid ldan pa rin chen dbang po ste /

original: yang dag par rig @145b pa'i rang bzhin thugs rdo rje /
analyzed: yang dag par rig @145b pa'i rang bzhin thugs rdo rje /

analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin nyid las chos kyi sku'o //
translated: From the nature of the absence of inherent existence is the dharma body.

analyzed: rang lha'i sa bon gyis mtshan ma //
translated: Marked with the seed syllable of oneâ€™s deity,

analyzed: so sor rtog par brjod par bya //

analyzed: sa bon gyis lha'i mtshan mar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /

analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa sa bon n'a da'i rang bzhin nyid kyis gsung rdo rje longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o // de nyid kyi phyir brjod par bya //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said:ğŸ”½The seed of the seed of the deityğŸ”½is the discriminating wisdom.

original: thams cad gcig gyur rjes gnas te //
analyzed: thams cad gcig gyur rjes gnas te //
translated: All become one, abiding in the aftermath,

original: rdzogs pa chos nyid dag pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa chos nyid dag pa'o //
translated: the perfection, the pure reality.

original: thams cad ces pa rdo rje gsum po rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa rdo rje gsum po rnams so //

original: gcig gyur zhes pa dbyer med pa gang yin pa de ni gcig go //

translated: â€œBecome oneâ€ means that which is inseparable is one.

original: chos nyid dag pa zhes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid dag pa zhes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid do //

analyzed: de ni rjes gnas zhes pa rjes su mtshungs pa ste /
translated: That is â€œabiding in the aftermath,â€ which means being the same in the aftermath.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas par ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas par ro //
translated: It abides in equality.

original: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The dharmadhatu, the nonconceptual gnosis, is nondual.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dag gis shes rab dang thabs so //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dag gis shes rab dang thabs so //
translated: The moon and sun are wisdom and means.

original: de'i bar gyi sa bon gyis lhan cig dbyer med pa'i phyir rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i bar gyi sa bon gyis lhan cig dbyer med pa'i phyir rdo rje gsum mo //

original: gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The complete reflection is the fourth, the connate.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: The extremely pure dharmadhatu itself is the abode.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga rnams so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga rnams so zhes pa'o //
translated: The five gnoses are the mirror-like gnosis, and so on.

original: yang na chos 'byung ni bdag med ma don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos 'byung ni bdag med ma don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the phenomena source is Nairatmya, the ultimate truth.

original: de las skyes pa ni rab tu gsal bar gyur ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni rab tu gsal bar gyur ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: What is born from that is the clear manifestation, the relative truth.

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pa gang yin pa de chos 'byung las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa gang yin pa de chos 'byung las skyes pa'o //
translated: What is the indivisibility of the two is born from the phenomena source.

original: de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'khor lo mi shes pa ma lus par gcod par byed pa'i phyir bdag med ma dang / dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'khor lo mi shes pa ma lus par gcod par byed pa'i phyir bdag med ma dang / dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
translated: Since it cuts through all ignorance of the wheel, it is Nairatmya, the intuition of Vajradhara, who is inseparable from her.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rim gnyis ni gnyis ka kha sbyor ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rim gnyis ni gnyis ka kha sbyor ro //
translated: Therefore, the two stages are the union of the two.

original: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
translated: Purity is natural purity.

original: skyon med pa zhes pa ma rig pa gdug pa'i sems rnams kyis dus yun ring mor rtag tu bar ma chad par goms shing /
analyzed: skyon med pa zhes pa ma rig pa gdug pa'i sems rnams kyis dus yun ring mor rtag tu bar ma chad par goms shing /
translated: The faultless is that, for a long time, the minds of the poisonous ignorance have been constantly and uninterruptedly habituated to the conception of the self of the person and the self of dharmas.

original: 'dir de'i 'dzin pas log par rtogs pas /
analyzed: 'dir de'i 'dzin pas log par rtogs pas /
translated: Here, by the conception of those, there is a false understanding.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi @146a * //ğŸ”½dbyings kyi rang bzhin kho na brtags nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi @146a * // dbyings kyi rang bzhin kho na brtags nas /
translated: The extremely pure nature of the dharmadhatu is imagined.

original: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i bag chags bsgom pa ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa nyid kyis skyon te nad lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i bag chags bsgom pa ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa nyid kyis skyon te nad lta bu'o //
translated: The habit-energy of all afflictions is a fault, because it generates suffering, like a disease.

original: de'i phyir sems can lha'i rnam pa rnam par dag pa nges par rtogs pa ni skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can lha'i rnam pa rnam par dag pa nges par rtogs pa ni skyon med pa'o //

original: 'dis ni nang gi rim pas dag pa dang / phyi'i rim pas skyon med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni nang gi rim pas dag pa dang / phyi'i rim pas skyon med pa ste /

original: phyi dang nang dbyer med pa 'di nyid ye shes so //
analyzed: phyi dang nang dbyer med pa 'di nyid ye shes so //
translated: This very inseparability of the outer and inner is gnosis.

original: de la gcig ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de la gcig ni gnyis su med pa'o //

original: ze 'bru yis yin te /
analyzed: ze 'bru yis yin te /

original: mtha' med cing thug pa med pa rdul phra rab bsags pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid dbyer med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtha' med cing thug pa med pa rdul phra rab bsags pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid dbyer med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the realization of the nature of all phenomena as indivisible, without end and without limit, the nature of an accumulation of subtle particles.

original: ae shes rab dang / ka bde ba thabs te so sor shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ae shes rab dang / ka bde ba thabs te so sor shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: de nyid gru gsum ni zur gsum ste rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de nyid gru gsum ni zur gsum ste rdo rje gsum mo //

original: gru gsum rdo rje gsum des gzhan bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gru gsum rdo rje gsum des gzhan bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: By that triangle, the three vajras, the other, the fourth, is connate.

original: de yang brjod ces pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang brjod ces pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kho na'o //
translated: That also is said to be the perfect gnosis alone.

original: de yi dbus su bsam bya'o //
analyzed: de yi dbus su bsam bya'o //
translated: One should imagine it in the middle of that.

original: zhes pa ye shes de'i dbus su dbu ma yang dag pa'i mthar 'dis rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ye shes de'i dbus su dbu ma yang dag pa'i mthar 'dis rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because this [verse] clearly illuminates the central channel, the perfect limit, in the middle of that pristine consciousness.

original: bsam bya rtogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam bya rtogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas par bya'o //
translated: It should be placed by the aspect of the realization of the object of thought.

original: de yang / ro chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang / ro chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang gi ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, the pristine consciousness of Vajradhara, inseparable from NairÄtmya, the nature of relative truth, the nature of the dharmadhÄtu, is the taste.

original: dbang po dang yul dang / de dag las skyes pa'i shes pa rnams ni bco lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang / de dag las skyes pa'i shes pa rnams ni bco lnga'o //

original: de rnams kyi bza' ba ni g-yeng ba sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bza' ba ni g-yeng ba sdud pa'o //
translated: The food of those is the gathering of distractions.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The nature of that is the essence of that.

original: rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i ye shes so //ğŸ”½de'i steng du zhes pa /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i ye shes so // de'i steng du zhes pa /
translated: The pristine consciousness of NairÄtmya, inseparable from Vajradhara, is the taste.

original: ta don yod grub pa /
analyzed: ta don yod grub pa /

original: sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje'o //

original: sa khu ba thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sa khu ba thugs rdo rje'o //

original: ya rlung gsung rdo rje ste /
analyzed: ya rlung gsung rdo rje ste /

analyzed: rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes ni ta sya zhes pa'o //

original: steng du ni de yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: steng du ni de yongs su gyur pa'o //

original: ci zhe na zla ba yin te /
analyzed: ci zhe na zla ba yin te /

analyzed: cha bco lnga'i bdag nyid can byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The moon is the bodhicitta, which has the nature of fifteen parts.

original: zla ba'i steng du sa bon te //
analyzed: zla ba'i steng du sa bon te //

analyzed: zhes pa / byang chub kyi sems yongs su gyur pa nyid khams gsum pa'i sa bon gyi rang bzhin kam yang dag pa'i ye shes so //

analyzed: 'dis rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin dga' ba'i ye shes brjod de /
translated: This expresses the joy pristine consciousness, which has the nature of Vairocana.

original: rnam @146b par nges pa dang bde ba'i ye shes gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam @146b par nges pa dang bde ba'i ye shes gsal ba'o //
translated: The pristine consciousness of certainty and bliss is clear.

analyzed: de bas lhag pa'i dga' ba ni mchog dga'i rang bzhin te //
translated: The joy that is greater than that is the nature of supreme joy.

original: de rgyas par byed pa'i phyir rin chen yin la /
analyzed: de rgyas par byed pa'i phyir rin chen yin la /
translated: Since it increases that, it is a jewel.

original: de'i dbang po ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de'i dbang po ni gtso bo ste /

original: de byed par bzod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de byed par bzod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: 'od dpag med ni dpag tu med pa ni mtha' yas pa'o ;
analyzed: 'od dpag med ni dpag tu med pa ni mtha' yas pa'o ;
translated: AmitÄbha is immeasurable, that is, infinite.

original: /'od ni snang ba ste /
analyzed: /'od ni snang ba ste /

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi ma rig pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni 'od dpag med de /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi ma rig pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni 'od dpag med de /
translated: The one who is free from ignorance of the objects, faculties, and consciousnesses is AmitÄbha,

analyzed: khyad par gyi dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of special joy.

original: de ltar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pas /
translated: Thus, because the three vajras are inseparable,

original: de yongs su gyur pa byang chub kyi sems de gang yin pa de dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid do //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa byang chub kyi sems de gang yin pa de dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid do //
translated: the gnosis that is inseparable from that bodhicitta that is the complete transformation of those three vajras is the true gnosis.

original: de yi steng du zla ba yin //
analyzed: de yi steng du zla ba yin //
translated: On top of that is the moon.

original: zla ba'i steng du sa bon te //
analyzed: zla ba'i steng du sa bon te //
translated: On top of the moon is the seed.

original: zhes pa'o // phyi nas zhes pa de ma thog par mchad pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // phyi nas zhes pa de ma thog par mchad pa nyid kyis te /
translated: â€œAfter thatâ€ means immediately after that, by the mere utterance of the seed syllable.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: â€œIn the form ofâ€ means by the nature of.

original: bdud las rgyal ba ni chags pa thams cad chags pa med par byed pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: bdud las rgyal ba ni chags pa thams cad chags pa med par byed pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: â€œVictorious over the mÄrasâ€ is the innate nature that transforms all attachments into nonattachment.

original: mnan pa ni rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mnan pa ni rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: â€œSubjugatedâ€ means realized.

original: gnyis 'dus pa'i khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag dbyer med pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis 'dus pa'i khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag dbyer med pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the inseparability of the innate nature and the semen and ovum of the two joined is the â€œvajra of bodhicitta.â€

original: bde ba chen po zhes pa ye shes chen po'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes pa ye shes chen po'o //
translated: Great bliss is great intuition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir a'a li'i gnas zhes pa a'a li mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir a'a li'i gnas zhes pa a'a li mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga ste /
translated: Therefore, the abode of the vowels is the fifteen dakinis of the vowels.

original: de gnas pa g-yo ba med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de gnas pa g-yo ba med par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the abode, which is the state of non-movement.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: zla ba'i gzugs khu ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs khu ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: By the form of the moon, which is the nature of the seminal essence.

original: k'a li'i gzugs kyis zhes pa kam bde ba'o //
analyzed: k'a li'i gzugs kyis zhes pa kam bde ba'o //
translated: By the form of the kalaviá¹…ka bird, which is the nature of the seminal essence.

original: de'i phreng ba ni a'a li ste /
analyzed: de'i phreng ba ni a'a li ste /
translated: The garland of that is the vowels.

original: dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mthar thug pas k'a li'o //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i mthar thug pas k'a li'o //
translated: The garland is the series of the joys beginning with the joy of the first stage and ending with the innate joy.

original: de'i gzugs dang de'i rang bzhin gyis snang byed 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang de'i rang bzhin gyis snang byed 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The form of that, the nature of that, is the illuminating clear light.

original: 'dis ni zla ba dang nyi ma khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gnyis po dag gang zhig 'dus shing dbyer med pa ste dkar mo la sogs pa rab tu grags zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni zla ba dang nyi ma khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin gnyis po dag gang zhig 'dus shing dbyer med pa ste dkar mo la sogs pa rab tu grags zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that the moon and the sun, which are the natures of the seminal essence and the innate joy, respectively, are united and inseparable, and are known as the white dakini and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can de ni ye shes so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can de ni ye shes so //
translated: The mandala is the inseparability of the two truths, which is gnosis.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
analyzed: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
translated: The moon is endowed with mirror-gnosis.

original: 'od gsal ba'i ye shes las tha dad pa'i byang chub kyi sems nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i ye shes las tha dad pa'i byang chub kyi sems nyid do //
translated: The bodhicitta itself is different from the gnosis of clear light.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni dbyer med pa ste /ğŸ”½byang chub kyi sems dang 'od gsal ba dag dbyer med @147a * //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni dbyer med pa ste / byang chub kyi sems dang 'od gsal ba dag dbyer med @147a * //
translated: Equality is non-differentiation.

original: par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhicitta and the clear light are realized as non-differentiated.

original: de ni bdun gyi bdun pa /
analyzed: de ni bdun gyi bdun pa /
translated: That is the seventh of the sevens.

original: nyi ma rin chen dbang po ste /
analyzed: nyi ma rin chen dbang po ste /
translated: The sun is the precious lord.

original: 'dis re zhig lhan cig skyes pa dang dbyer med pa'i khu ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis re zhig lhan cig skyes pa dang dbyer med pa'i khu ba nyid do //
translated: This is the semen, which is inseparable from the innate.
